Why do some antivirus software, like Avast and Kaspersky, flag the Verus software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP"?

Avast and Kaspersky may flag the Verus software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP" (Potentially Unwanted Program) because it is mining software, which can be used by third parties to exploit your PC. This is a false positive warning, and you can learn more about it by reviewing resources from Malwarebytes and Kaspersky.
